speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: SCENE V. OLIVIA'S house.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter MARIA and Clown

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Nay, either tell me where thou hast been, or I will

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: not open my lips so wide as a bristle may enter in

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: way of thy excuse: my lady will hang thee for thy absence.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Let her hang me: he that is well hanged in this

speaker: Clown
text_entry: world needs to fear no colours.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Make that good.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: He shall see none to fear.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: A good lenten answer: I can tell thee where that

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: saying was born, of 'I fear no colours.'

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Where, good Mistress Mary?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: In the wars; and that may you be bold to say in your foolery.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Well, God give them wisdom that have it; and those

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that are fools, let them use their talents.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Yet you will be hanged for being so long absent; or,

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: to be turned away, is not that as good as a hanging to you?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Many a good hanging prevents a bad marriage; and,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: for turning away, let summer bear it out.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: You are resolute, then?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Not so, neither; but I am resolved on two points.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: That if one break, the other will hold; or, if both

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: break, your gaskins fall.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Apt, in good faith; very apt. Well, go thy way; if

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Sir Toby would leave drinking, thou wert as witty a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: piece of Eve's flesh as any in Illyria.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Peace, you rogue, no more o' that. Here comes my

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: lady: make your excuse wisely, you were best.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Wit, an't be thy will, put me into good fooling!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Those wits, that think they have thee, do very oft

speaker: Clown
text_entry: prove fools; and I, that am sure I lack thee, may

speaker: Clown
text_entry: pass for a wise man: for what says Quinapalus?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Better a witty fool, than a foolish wit.'

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA with MALVOLIO

speaker: Clown
text_entry: God bless thee, lady!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Take the fool away.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Do you not hear, fellows? Take away the lady.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Go to, you're a dry fool; I'll no more of you:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: besides, you grow dishonest.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Two faults, madonna, that drink and good counsel

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will amend: for give the dry fool drink, then is

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the fool not dry: bid the dishonest man mend

speaker: Clown
text_entry: himself; if he mend, he is no longer dishonest; if

speaker: Clown
text_entry: he cannot, let the botcher mend him. Any thing

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that's mended is but patched: virtue that

speaker: Clown
text_entry: transgresses is but patched with sin; and sin that

speaker: Clown
text_entry: amends is but patched with virtue. If that this

speaker: Clown
text_entry: simple syllogism will serve, so; if it will not,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: what remedy? As there is no true cuckold but

speaker: Clown
text_entry: calamity, so beauty's a flower. The lady bade take

speaker: Clown
text_entry: away the fool; therefore, I say again, take her away.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Sir, I bade them take away you.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Misprision in the highest degree! Lady, cucullus non

speaker: Clown
text_entry: facit monachum; that's as much to say as I wear not

speaker: Clown
text_entry: motley in my brain. Good madonna, give me leave to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: prove you a fool.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Can you do it?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Dexterously, good madonna.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Make your proof.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I must catechise you for it, madonna: good my mouse

speaker: Clown
text_entry: of virtue, answer me.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Well, sir, for want of other idleness, I'll bide your proof.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Good madonna, why mournest thou?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Good fool, for my brother's death.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I think his soul is in hell, madonna.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I know his soul is in heaven, fool.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: The more fool, madonna, to mourn for your brother's

speaker: Clown
text_entry: soul being in heaven. Take away the fool, gentlemen.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What think you of this fool, Malvolio? doth he not mend?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Yes, and shall do till the pangs of death shake him:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: infirmity, that decays the wise, doth ever make the

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: better fool.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: God send you, sir, a speedy infirmity, for the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: better increasing your folly! Sir Toby will be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sworn that I am no fox; but he will not pass his

speaker: Clown
text_entry: word for two pence that you are no fool.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How say you to that, Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I marvel your ladyship takes delight in such a

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: barren rascal: I saw him put down the other day

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: with an ordinary fool that has no more brain

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: than a stone. Look you now, he's out of his guard

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: already; unless you laugh and minister occasion to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: him, he is gagged. I protest, I take these wise men,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that crow so at these set kind of fools, no better

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: than the fools' zanies.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Oh, you are sick of self-love, Malvolio, and taste

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: with a distempered appetite. To be generous,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: guiltless and of free disposition, is to take those

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: things for bird-bolts that you deem cannon-bullets:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: there is no slander in an allowed fool, though he do

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: nothing but rail; nor no railing in a known discreet

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: man, though he do nothing but reprove.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Now Mercury endue thee with leasing, for thou

speaker: Clown
text_entry: speakest well of fools!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Re-enter MARIA

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Madam, there is at the gate a young gentleman much

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: desires to speak with you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: From the Count Orsino, is it?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: I know not, madam: 'tis a fair young man, and well attended.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Who of my people hold him in delay?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Sir Toby, madam, your kinsman.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Fetch him off, I pray you; he speaks nothing but

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: madman: fie on him!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exit MARIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Go you, Malvolio: if it be a suit from the count, I

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: am sick, or not at home; what you will, to dismiss it.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exit MALVOLIO

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Now you see, sir, how your fooling grows old, and

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: people dislike it.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Thou hast spoke for us, madonna, as if thy eldest

speaker: Clown
text_entry: son should be a fool; whose skull Jove cram with

speaker: Clown
text_entry: brains! for,--here he comes,--one of thy kin has a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: most weak pia mater.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: By mine honour, half drunk. What is he at the gate, cousin?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: A gentleman.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A gentleman! what gentleman?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: 'Tis a gentle man here--a plague o' these

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: pickle-herring! How now, sot!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Good Sir Toby!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Cousin, cousin, how have you come so early by this lethargy?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Lechery! I defy lechery. There's one at the gate.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Ay, marry, what is he?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Let him be the devil, an he will, I care not: give

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: me faith, say I. Well, it's all one.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What's a drunken man like, fool?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Like a drowned man, a fool and a mad man: one

speaker: Clown
text_entry: draught above heat makes him a fool; the second mads

speaker: Clown
text_entry: him; and a third drowns him.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Go thou and seek the crowner, and let him sit o' my

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: coz; for he's in the third degree of drink, he's

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: drowned: go, look after him.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: He is but mad yet, madonna; and the fool shall look

speaker: Clown
text_entry: to the madman.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Re-enter MALVOLIO

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Madam, yond young fellow swears he will speak with

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: you. I told him you were sick; he takes on him to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: understand so much, and therefore comes to speak

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: with you. I told him you were asleep; he seems to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: have a foreknowledge of that too, and therefore

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: comes to speak with you. What is to be said to him,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: lady? he's fortified against any denial.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Tell him he shall not speak with me.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Has been told so; and he says, he'll stand at your

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: door like a sheriff's post, and be the supporter to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: a bench, but he'll speak with you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What kind o' man is he?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Why, of mankind.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What manner of man?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Of very ill manner; he'll speak with you, will you or no.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Of what personage and years is he?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Not yet old enough for a man, nor young enough for

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: a boy; as a squash is before 'tis a peascod, or a

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: cooling when 'tis almost an apple: 'tis with him

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: in standing water, between boy and man. He is very

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: well-favoured and he speaks very shrewishly; one

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: would think his mother's milk were scarce out of him.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Let him approach: call in my gentlewoman.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Gentlewoman, my lady calls.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Re-enter MARIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Give me my veil: come, throw it o'er my face.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: We'll once more hear Orsino's embassy.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter VIOLA, and Attendants

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: The honourable lady of the house, which is she?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Speak to me; I shall answer for her.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Your will?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Most radiant, exquisite and unmatchable beauty,--I

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: pray you, tell me if this be the lady of the house,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: for I never saw her: I would be loath to cast away

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: my speech, for besides that it is excellently well

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: penned, I have taken great pains to con it. Good

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: beauties, let me sustain no scorn; I am very

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: comptible, even to the least sinister usage.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Whence came you, sir?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I can say little more than I have studied, and that

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: question's out of my part. Good gentle one, give me

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: modest assurance if you be the lady of the house,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: that I may proceed in my speech.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Are you a comedian?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: No, my profound heart: and yet, by the very fangs

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: of malice I swear, I am not that I play. Are you

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: the lady of the house?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If I do not usurp myself, I am.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Most certain, if you are she, you do usurp

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: yourself; for what is yours to bestow is not yours

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: to reserve. But this is from my commission: I will

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: on with my speech in your praise, and then show you

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: the heart of my message.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Come to what is important in't: I forgive you the praise.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Alas, I took great pains to study it, and 'tis poetical.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: It is the more like to be feigned: I pray you,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: keep it in. I heard you were saucy at my gates,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: and allowed your approach rather to wonder at you

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: than to hear you. If you be not mad, be gone; if

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: you have reason, be brief: 'tis not that time of

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: moon with me to make one in so skipping a dialogue.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Will you hoist sail, sir? here lies your way.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: No, good swabber; I am to hull here a little

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: longer. Some mollification for your giant, sweet

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: lady. Tell me your mind: I am a messenger.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Sure, you have some hideous matter to deliver, when

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: the courtesy of it is so fearful. Speak your office.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: It alone concerns your ear. I bring no overture of

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: war, no taxation of homage: I hold the olive in my

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: hand; my words are as fun of peace as matter.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Yet you began rudely. What are you? what would you?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: The rudeness that hath appeared in me have I

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: learned from my entertainment. What I am, and what I

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: would, are as secret as maidenhead; to your ears,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: divinity, to any other's, profanation.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Give us the place alone: we will hear this divinity.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt MARIA and Attendants

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Now, sir, what is your text?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Most sweet lady,--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A comfortable doctrine, and much may be said of it.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Where lies your text?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: In Orsino's bosom.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: In his bosom! In what chapter of his bosom?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: To answer by the method, in the first of his heart.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, I have read it: it is heresy. Have you no more to say?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Good madam, let me see your face.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Have you any commission from your lord to negotiate

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: with my face? You are now out of your text: but

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: we will draw the curtain and show you the picture.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Look you, sir, such a one I was this present: is't

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: not well done?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Unveiling

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Excellently done, if God did all.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: 'Tis in grain, sir; 'twill endure wind and weather.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: 'Tis beauty truly blent, whose red and white

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Nature's own sweet and cunning hand laid on:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Lady, you are the cruell'st she alive,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: If you will lead these graces to the grave

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And leave the world no copy.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, sir, I will not be so hard-hearted; I will give

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: out divers schedules of my beauty: it shall be

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: inventoried, and every particle and utensil

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: labelled to my will: as, item, two lips,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: indifferent red; item, two grey eyes, with lids to

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: them; item, one neck, one chin, and so forth. Were

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: you sent hither to praise me?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I see you what you are, you are too proud;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But, if you were the devil, you are fair.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My lord and master loves you: O, such love

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Could be but recompensed, though you were crown'd

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: The nonpareil of beauty!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How does he love me?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: With adorations, fertile tears,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: With groans that thunder love, with sighs of fire.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Your lord does know my mind; I cannot love him:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Yet I suppose him virtuous, know him noble,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Of great estate, of fresh and stainless youth;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: In voices well divulged, free, learn'd and valiant;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And in dimension and the shape of nature

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A gracious person: but yet I cannot love him;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: He might have took his answer long ago.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: If I did love you in my master's flame,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: With such a suffering, such a deadly life,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: In your denial I would find no sense;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I would not understand it.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Why, what would you?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Make me a willow cabin at your gate,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And call upon my soul within the house;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Write loyal cantons of contemned love

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And sing them loud even in the dead of night;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Halloo your name to the reverberate hills

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And make the babbling gossip of the air

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Cry out 'Olivia!' O, You should not rest

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Between the elements of air and earth,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But you should pity me!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: You might do much.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What is your parentage?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Above my fortunes, yet my state is well:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I am a gentleman.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Get you to your lord;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I cannot love him: let him send no more;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Unless, perchance, you come to me again,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To tell me how he takes it. Fare you well:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I thank you for your pains: spend this for me.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I am no fee'd post, lady; keep your purse:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My master, not myself, lacks recompense.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Love make his heart of flint that you shall love;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And let your fervor, like my master's, be

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Placed in contempt! Farewell, fair cruelty.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: 'What is your parentage?'

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: 'Above my fortunes, yet my state is well:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I am a gentleman.' I'll be sworn thou art;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Thy tongue, thy face, thy limbs, actions and spirit,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Do give thee five-fold blazon: not too fast:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: soft, soft!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Unless the master were the man. How now!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Even so quickly may one catch the plague?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Methinks I feel this youth's perfections

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: With an invisible and subtle stealth

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To creep in at mine eyes. Well, let it be.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What ho, Malvolio!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Re-enter MALVOLIO

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Here, madam, at your service.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Run after that same peevish messenger,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: The county's man: he left this ring behind him,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Would I or not: tell him I'll none of it.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Desire him not to flatter with his lord,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Nor hold him up with hopes; I am not for him:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If that the youth will come this way to-morrow,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I'll give him reasons for't: hie thee, Malvolio.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Madam, I will.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I do I know not what, and fear to find

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Mine eye too great a flatterer for my mind.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Fate, show thy force: ourselves we do not owe;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What is decreed must be, and be this so.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exit
